eshmun.modelrepair.debug.notcnf

Class KripkeFormulaGeneratorNotCNF

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.modelrepair.debug.notcnf.KripkeFormulaGeneratorNotCNF

  • public class KripkeFormulaGeneratorNotCNF
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to generate the repair formula for a single Kripke Structure.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    KripkeStructure

      • KripkeFormulaGeneratorNotCNF

        public KripkeFormulaGeneratorNotCNF(java.lang.String structureName,
                                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,AbstractState> states,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<AbstractState> startStates,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<AbstractState> retainStates,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTransition> transitions,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTransition> retainTransitions,
                                    java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> allLabels,
                                    AbstractExpression specifications,
                                    KripkeFormulaGenerator f)
        Create a new Formula Generator for the given structure and specifications.
        Parameters:
        structureName - the name of the structure to be repaired.
        states - a mapping from names to States.
        startStates - a list of start States.
        retainStates - a list of retain States.
        transitions - a list of Transitions
        retainTransitions - a list of retain Transitions.
        allLabels - all the labels in the structure.
        specifications - The specifications of the Kripke Structure, will be simplified inside.
        f - an equivalent formula generator in CNF.

        Parameters:

        formula - the formula that the variable belongs to.
        m - the super index, represents the number of propagations

      • generateRepairFormula

        public AndOperator generateRepairFormula()
                                  throws NotCNFException
        Generate the repair formula for the given structure.
        Returns:
        An AndOperator in CNF format that is the repair formula.
        Throws:
        NotCNFException - if the formula was not successfully converted to CNF internally.

      • flowConstraints

        private AndOperator flowConstraints()
        Construct a formula that forces the flow of the model (totality, transition needs the start and ends states).

        These are the 3rd and 4th rule in the paper.

        Keeping a transition implies that both its start and end states should be kept, This result in the following constraint:
            E => S_start & S_end

        Keeping a state is also equivalent to keeping one or more of its transitions (and end start), This preserves totality, and results in the following constraint:
            S <=> (E1 & S_end1) | (E2 & S_end2) | ..
        However, due to the first condition, we can reduce this to     S => E1 | E2 | ..

        Also, if a state is kept it should be reachable, this result in the following constrain:
            S => E`1 | E`2 | ..
        Where E`1, E`2, ... are transitions that end in S.

        Returns:
        an AndOperator that forces the flow constraints described above, in CNF format.
        See Also:
        AndOperator

      • retainStartStates

        private AndOperator retainStartStates()
        Constructs a formula that forces the retain of some start state, Notice that the retain of a start state requires that it satisfies the specifications.

        The retain is done through adding a disjunction to the repair formula, containing the variables relating to the start states.

        Also if a state is retained it implies that it satisfies the specification.

        Returns:
        an OrOperator that ands the variables related to the start states, in CNF format.
        See Also:
        OrOperator

      • retainStatesAndTransitions

        private AndOperator retainStatesAndTransitions()
        Constructs a formula that forces the retain of States and Transitions that were marked as retain.

        The retain is done through adding a conjecture to the repair formula, containing the variables relating to the States and Transitions.

        The retain also requires that the states and transitions are reachable, which is enforced by requiring their parents to be reachable, and so on..

        Returns:
        an AndOperator that ands the variables related to the retained States and Transitions, in CNF format.
        See Also:
        AndOperator

      • reachableTransition

        private AbstractExpression reachableTransition(AbstractTransition transition,
                                               java.util.HashSet<AbstractTransition> retained,
                                               int count)
        Forces a transition to be retained by forcing its parents to be retained.
        Parameters:
        transition - the transition to retain.
        retained - a set of previously retained transitions, plays the role of 'visited'.
        count - used to count down
        Returns:
        an expression in CNF that forces the retainment of the given transition.

      • labelsPerState

        private AndOperator labelsPerState()
        Construct an AndOperator, each variable inside the AndOperator related to a label and a state.

        If the variable was not negated it means that the state satisfies the label, if it was negated it means the state doesn't satisfy the label.

        Returns:
        AndOperator for relating states to labels, in CNF format.
        See Also:
        AndOperator
